text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Tuesday. Prepared for Reuters by the Cooperation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:

- The Russian embassy in Latvia announced that statements by Welfare Minister Vladimir Makarov who said that pensions of Russian military pensioners may be taxed are contrary to the agreement between the two countries.
- According to unofficial information, the person who threatened to kill Prime Minister Andris Shkele last week was Andris Silinsh, a hockey coach. He was arrested by police last Friday.

- On September 18, Shkele leaves for an official visit to Iceland. After visiting there he will go straight to the USA and will return in Latvia on September 26. No decision has been made who will be the acting prime minister in his absence.

- Representatives of several ruling political parties believe that the question of the dismissal of Finance Minister Aivar Kreituss has to be decided by Shkele and not the government party council. Deputy Prime Minister Ziedonis Chevers said his party would not ask for the dismissal of Kreituss until Shkele's return to Latvia. kreituss belongs to Chevers' party.
- A parliament committee says the parliament speaker's office spent too much money on furnishing its premises.
- A Japanese parliamentary delegation is visiting Latvia.

- The Ministry of Justice Judicial Department will ask the Prosecutor's Office to verify whether Jehovah's Witnesses in Latvia are acting in line with the law. Last week, a young girl died in a Riga hospital after her mother, a Jehovah's Witness, stopped doctors from making a blood transfusion.
- Two ladies, employees of Zemes Banka, have disappeared after allegedly embezzling 400,000 lats from the bank.

- Latvia has not yet received any official reply to the proposals made to Lithuania in the last round of talks on the delimitation of their sea border. Shkele's foreign policy adviser Aivars Groza admits that the reply may come after Shkele has returned from Iceland and the United States on September 26.
